poem:
**Denied at the Acropolis**

Parthenon stands in stubborn stone,  
scripts of silence, whispers of time,  
rejecting starlit futures,  
lenses seeking echoes of gods  
behind columns of history.  
Lanthimos, your visions clouded  
by ancient air, dust of myth  
unbending, yet the dream persists  
—unfilmable, unyielding, underneath  
Athena's eternal watch.
